Tenure.origin: [Anglo-French, feudal holding, from Old French teneüre , from Medieval Latin tenitura , ultimately from Latin tenēre to hold]

1.definition: the act, manner, duration, or right of holding something [ of office]the manner of holding real propertythe title and conditions by which property is held [freehold ]

2.definition: a status granted to a teacher usually after a probationary period that protects him or her from dismissal except for reasons of incompetence, gross misconduct, or financial necessity
